result.execSummary:
The defendant Ryan L Kohlman was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Forgery-Uttering, a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.38(2).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: CONCURRENT to any current sentence serving

superMiscConds.notes: Provide DNA sample. Pay all court costs, fees, surcharges including the mandatory DNA surcharge and restitution surcharges from 25% of prison funds, collected by DOC's. Restitution is to be paid FIRST, all other monetary obligations thereafter. Pay all applicable fees of supervision. A payment plan for all monetary obligations is to be established by DOC's, Probation and Parole. All unpaid monetary balances at the end of said period will convert to a civil judgment.

- AODA assessment and cooperate with any programs deemed necessary by the State of Wisconsin department of corrections.
- Absolute sobriety. No alcohol. No drugs.
- No possession, consumption, selling distributing of illegal drugs, alcohol.
- Random urine screens; if deemed appropriate.
- No contact with victim, Deborah T.

Ineligible Voting Notice And Acknowledgement, FILED.

Defendant Ryan L Kohlman in court with attorney Anne A Devitt.  Michael Lonski appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for 06-24-2014 at 01:30 pm.
-Scanned; ENTRY MADE WITHOUT COURT FILE.  Deputy Court Clerk: TC.

Attorney Anne A Devitt in court, defendant Ryan L Kohlman not in court, in custody.  Janet C Protasiewicz appeared for the State of Wisconsin on behalf of Michael Lonski.
  Status conference scheduled for 05-07-2014 at 08:30 am.

Court orders a $500.00 signature bond to convert to a $500.00 cash bail if defendant is released from custody in Waukesha County.
  Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for SUPERVISION*** IF*** the signature bond reverts to cash.

Defendant waived Preliminary Hearing.  Preliminary Hearing Questionnaire and Waiver received and filed.  Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Witkowiak, Branch 22.  Original Information filed.  Copy given to defense counsel who waived reading.  Defendant plead not guilty.

Defendant Ryan L Kohlman in court with attorney Anne A. Devitt.  Defendant Ryan L Kohlman in custody.  Carole R. Manchester appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Witkowiak, Branch 22.  Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold defendant for further proceedings.  
DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.  Scheduling conference scheduled for April 15, 2014 at 08:30 am.
